text:
Using FreeBSD 5.3 current with Apache 1.3.33

- Using the option zlib.output_compression = On the Header line 'Content-
Encoding: gzip' is not sent. Content shows up as garbage in the browser
- Using ob_start ('ob_gzhandler') within the code does work.
- Addinng a Header ('Content-Encoding: gzip') together with 
zlib.output_compression does work for normal page but fails with images (and is 
only a hack).

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
zlib.output_compression--- isn't this a PHP setting?

I belive you should report this to the php bug database first.  It doesn't seem to indicate an issue inside 
apache.

Thanks,

-Paul

It seems that this a FreeBSD specific problem. Because in the FreeBSD ports 
becuase www/mod_php5 and archivers/php5-zlib are build separate.

There is a ugly dependency of the ZLIB library in main/SAPI.c. There is a 
#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB switch where the Content-Encoding header will be generated. 
But on FreeBSD because mod_php5 is build without zlib support!

Adding something like CONFIGURE_ARGS+= --with-zlib=/usr --with-zlib-dir=/usr in 
the Makefile that build mod_php5 resolves the problem but bundles the zlib 
library (which is ok for me)
